meanings.definition: The growth or movement of a plant in response to water.
meanings.sent1: The hydrotropism of the plant caused it to bend towards the water source.
meanings.sent2: The farmer observed the hydrotropism of the roots as they extended towards the moist soil.
meanings.sent3: The hydrotropism of the flowers made them seem like they were dancing in the rain.
meanings.sent4: The hydrotropism of the vines reaching for the water resembled a graceful ballet performance.
meanings.sent5: The vivid hydrotropism of the leaves turning towards the rain made a lasting impression on the botanist.

meanings.definition: The tendency of a plant to grow towards or away from water.
meanings.sent1: The hydrotropism of the seedling guided it towards the water-filled pot.
meanings.sent2: The gardener studied the hydrotropism of the plant to understand its water-seeking behavior.
meanings.sent3: The hydrotropism of the cactus trying to escape the rain was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The hydrotropism of the roots avoiding the waterlogged area was a clever survival strategy.
meanings.sent5: The striking hydrotropism of the plant bending away from the floodwaters was a sight to behold.
